findings.title: Contracts are vulnerable to permanent blocking by any token holder
findings.description: Arrays `ERC20POC.arr_pegin_submit` and `BEP20POC.pegout_submit` could be filled by a malicious token holder using the methods listed above. This would drastically increase the gas cost of methods `pegout_submit_complete`, `pegout_submit_delete`, `pegout_submit_cancel`, `pegin_submit_complete`, `pegin_submit_delete`, and `pegin_submit_cancel`, leading to permanent inoperability of these methods.

findings.title: Potential loss of usersâ€™ submits and data inconsistency
findings.description: When several users call methods within one block, only the last one will create an order because the key for storing data in `arr_pegout_submit` and `arr_pegin_submit` is generated only based on `block.timestamp`.

findings.title: Missing event for changing `_fee_rate`
findings.description: Changing critical values should be followed by event emitting for better off-chain tracking.

findings.title: A public function that could be declared external
findings.description: Public functions that are never called by the contract should be declared external to save gas.
findings.location: Contracts: `POC_ERC20.sol`, `POC_BEP20.sol`; Functions: Multiple functions listed (e.g., `pegin_run`, `transferFrom`, `staff_list`, etc.)

findings.title: Boolean equality
findings.description: Boolean constants can be used directly and do not need to be compared to `true` or `false`.

findings.title: Code and documentation inconsistency
findings.description: According to documentation, the maximum fee should be 100%, but contracts allow setting it up to 1000%.
